title: Topic 004 Question 014
body: A company has an Azure point-to-site virtual private network (VPN) that uses certificate-based authentication.
An error message appears when a user tries to connect to the VPN by using a VPN client on a Windows 11 machine:
A certificate could not be found.
You need to resolve the issue.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct selection presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
options: Install a client certificate on the VPN gateway.
Install a root certificate on the user’s device.
Configure an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenant.
Enable Azure AD authentication on the gateway.
Install a client certificate on the user’s device.
